code:
smtp_host = "smtp.gmail.com"
    smtp_port = 587
    smtp_username = "admin"
    smtp_password = "admin"
    smtp_use_tls = True
    smtp_auth = (smtp_host, smtp_port, smtp_username, smtp_password)
    smtp_connection = smtp.SMTP(smtp_host, smtp_port)
    smtp_connection.login(smtp_username, smtp_password)
    smtp_connection.sendmail(smtp_host, smtp_username, smtp_password)

code:
def create_ssl_context():
 ssl_context = ssl.SSLContext()
 ssl_context.set_verify_mode(ssl.SSL_VERIFY_PEER)
 ssl_context.set_verify_mode(ssl.SSL_VERIFY_NONE)
 ssl_context.set_verify_peer(True)
 ssl_context.set_ssl_context(ssl_context)
 return ssl_context

text: Write a python code that creates a SSL for https context with check_hostname

def create_ssl_context(self):
        context = SSLContext()
        context.set_verify_mode(SSLContext.VERIFY_PEER)
        context.set_verify_mode(SSLContext.VERIFY_NONE)
        return context
